page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY DARTMOOR
page.content: There are granite buildings and boundaries of various periods from medieval times.Scobitor Farm has had a continuous occupation from Saxon times and is mentioned in {Domesday Book}.In the 13th. century it was passed to the monks of Torre Abbey by the Bokeland family and remained the property of the Abbey until the 16th. century.The present house was enlarged in the late 19th.century and incorporates two Dartmoor long houses. On the adjacent tor is a tower-like structure built in 1868 for an unknown purpose. A drift road,formerly used for taking animals onto Buckland Common for grazing goes from Buckland village past Bowden Farm.Large beech trees border the righthand side where it passes Birch Wood.The road funnels out onto the moor through Ripman's Gate.
